FacilityName: M&L Commodities dba Lineage Logistics - Stockton

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Stationary Source 
Lineage Logistics has a long-standing commitment to worker, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as personnel training and consideration of safety in the design, operation, and maintenance of the ammonia refrigeration system.  It is Lineage Logistics policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances.  
The Program 3 at Lineage Logistics - Port of Stockton is a facility-run program with continuous support from Lineage Logistics  Safety and Compliance Department that includes Process Safety Management (PSM) Compliance and Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) Compliance. 
  
Stationary Source and Regulated Substance Handled
Lineage Logistics - Port of Stockton is located at 2323 Port Road A, Stockton. California. The area immediately surrounding the facility is mostly urban with some industrial and residential areas.
The regulated substance handled at the facility is anhydrous ammonia.  The facility's primary activities revolve around large-scale public storage of food products.  All the ammonia inventory is used as a refrigerant.

General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps
As part of the implementation of the RMP Program, key Prevention Program elements were documented and implemented by Lineage Logistics - Port of Stockton, which also serves to manage process safety issues associated with the use of anhydrous ammonia.  Furthermore, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are currently utilized to ensure safe practices are being performed.  The regulated substance is over the 10,000-lbs. federal threshold for EPA RMP and OSHA PSM.   As a result, the anhydrous ammonia-covered process (ammonia refrigeration system) is subject to OSHA PSM and EPA Program 3.
Program 3 Prevention Program Elements include:

	Process Safety Information
	Process Hazard Analysis
	Operating Procedures
	Training
	Mechanical Integrity
	Management of Change
	Pre- Start Safety Review
	Compliance Audits
	Incident Investigation
	Employee Participation
	Hot Work Permit
	Contractors

Five-Year Accident History
For any accidental release meeting the five-year accident history reporting criteria of §68.42(a), the owner or operator shall submit as part of the RMP the information required by Section §68.42(b) on each accident covered by section §68.42(a).
The owner or operator shall include in the five-year accident history all accidental releases from covered processes that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on-site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.

Lineage Logistics - Port of Stockton has had no releases in the last five years that meets the five-year accident history reporting criteria; therefore, no data is required. 

Emergency Response Program
Lineage Logistics - Port of Stockton has developed and implemented an emergency response program. 
The facility is not a first responder facility.  Therefore, is not required to have an Emergency Response Plan (ERP).   An Emergency Action Plan (EAP) is in place to properly prepare for emergency evacuations, to provide first aid and medical treatment and to contact federal, state, and local officials in the event of a major release of ammonia.   

The Facility emergency response program is coordinated with the local responding units such as HAZMAT Team and the local (Stockton) Fire Department.  Detailed information can be found within the facility EAP which is located at the facility.  
In addition, the Facility has submitted a 2023 Hazardous Material Inventory (HMI) Business Plan via California Environmental Reporting System (CERS).  

Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Several studies have been conducted to examine mitigation measures to

improve safety at the facility.  These studies include:
	A Hazard Assessment was performed on June 6, 2023
	A Seismic Assessment was performed in May 2023
	A Process Hazard Analysis was performed on April 3, 2023
	A Compliance audit was performed on January 19, 2021
	A Five Year Mechanical Integrity was performed on November 16, 2021
Any outstanding recommendations from these studies and the target completion date or closure have been provided within each individual report.
